name: Malva
description: Malva, commonly known as Mallow, is a genus of about 30 species of herbaceous plants in the family Malvaceae, native to Europe, northern Africa and temperate Asia.The plant produces beautiful, eye-catching, cup-shaped flowers in romantic shades. All Mallow flowers have five petals and vary in color from pink to purple and white. Mallow is a great border plant that will add color to any garden!
meaning: The genus name is derived from the Greek word “malakos”, which means “soft” or “mellow”, in reference to the special qualities of the plant in softening and healing.
color_description: The flowers are usually pink, purple and white.
